4 
Specification of PU Elements during the 2022-2025 period 
4.1 
For the purposes of this Article, a specification upgrade is defined as a modification of a 
homologated part for any purpose other than those listed in 5.1 below. 
4.2 
With reference to Article 28.2 of the Sporting Regulations, each Power Unit Manufacturer 
may supply only the maximum number of specification upgrades of PU elements as set in the 
second table of Appendix 3 of the Technical Regulations during a Championship season, 
except for any changes permitted by the FIA in accordance with the procedures set out in 
Paragraph 5 below. 
4.3 
In order to be registered, a specification upgrade must be used by at least one car powered 
by the Power Unit Manufacturer no later than: 
 the first Event following the deadline specified in the second table of Appendix 3 of the

by the Power Unit Manufacturer no later than: 
 the first Event following the deadline specified in the second table of Appendix 3 of the 
Technical Regulations if at least one car would incur no penalty under art. 28.3 of the 
Sporting Regulations. 
 the fifth Event following the deadline specified in the second table of Appendix 3 of the 
Technical Regulations if all cars would incur a penalty under art. 28.3 of the Sporting 
Regulations. 
4.4 
Requests for the homologation of parts with permitted specification upgrades must be 
submitted at least 14 days before the requested date of homologation. 
4.5 
With reference to Article 40.3 of the Sporting Regulations, if a Power Unit part is 
subsequently replaced by another of a different specification according to 4.2 after a 
between the Sprint Qualifying Session and the Sprint Session, or between the Qualifying 
practice Session and the Race, the replacement Power Unit part will not be considered the

between the Sprint Qualifying Session and the Sprint Session, or between the Qualifying 
practice Session and the Race, the replacement Power Unit part will not be considered the 
same in design or similar in mass, inertia or function. 
4.6 
A customer Competitor may refuse a specification upgrade, or request a delay, in case of 
installation issues of the new Power Unit element in its car. The customer Competitor must 
apply in writing to the FIA Technical Department and must provide all necessary supporting 
information. If the FIA is satisfied, in its absolute discretion, that the installation issues are 
genuine, they will confirm approval to the customer Competitor and to the Power Unit 
Manufacturer. In this case, the provisions of 6.2 below won’t apply. 
5 
Permitted modifications to the homologated power unit elements 
5.1 
A manufacturer may apply to the FIA during the course of the homologation period to carry

5 
Permitted modifications to the homologated power unit elements 
5.1 
A manufacturer may apply to the FIA during the course of the homologation period to carry 
out modifications to the homologated Power Unit elements for the sole purposes of 
reliability, safety, cost saving, supply issues, or minimal incidental changes permitted in 5.4 
below. 
Applications must be made in writing to the FIA Technical Department and must provide all 
necessary supporting information including, where appropriate, clear evidence of failures. 
The FIA will circulate the correspondence to all Power Unit Manufacturers for comment. If 
the FIA is satisfied, in its absolute discretion, that these changes are acceptable, they will 
confirm to the Power Unit Manufacturer concerned that they may be carried out.

Wherever practical, such requests must be submitted at least 14 days before the requested 
date of homologation. 
The procedure and associated document templates that must be used by the Power Unit 
Manufacturers for their requests are available in the Appendix of the Regulations. 
5.2 
Modifications may be considered as minor if there is no or very limited effect on reliability 
and either the design of the part is not changed (e.g. change of supplier, change of part 
number …etc) or the geometrical change is minor, this attribute being subject to approval of 
the FIA at its sole discretion. These modifications must be clearly identified as minor in the 
requests, and they will be registered as such after approval by the other PU Manufacturers 
and the FIA. For such minor modifications, the PU Manufacturer may also request the

requests, and they will be registered as such after approval by the other PU Manufacturers 
and the FIA. For such minor modifications, the PU Manufacturer may also request the 
possibility of exhausting the existing stock of parts alongside the use of the modified parts, 
and this must also be clearly specified in the request if applicable. In this case, there must be 
no preferential allocation of the modified parts between the Competitors supplied by the PU 
Manufacturer. 
5.3 
An amendment to the published regulations that occurs after the start of the homologation 
may be used to modify components concerned by that amendment. 
5.4 
Minimal incidental changes may be carried out for car installation purposes to the following 
components of the Power Unit: 
a. 
Wirings 
b. Exhaust system, provided the key defining parameters of the system (diameters, 
lengths, etc.) remain fundamentally unchanged 
c.

components of the Power Unit: 
a. 
Wirings 
b. Exhaust system, provided the key defining parameters of the system (diameters, 
lengths, etc.) remain fundamentally unchanged 
c. 
Turbo-compressor position (within 20mm from the original position in relation to the 
ICE), turbo clocking, turbo supports 
d. Position of the wastegates with housings and pipes 
e. 
Position of the pop-off valves with housings and pipes 
f. 
Air Inlet system as defined in row 44 of the first table of Appendix 3, provided the key 
defining parameters of the system (diameters, lengths, etc.) remain fundamentally 
unchanged 
5.5 
Any permitted modifications concerning parts that are inside the sealed perimeter (i.e. parts 
described as “INC” in the “Art. 5.23 Seal. Perim.” column of Appendix 3 of the Technical 
Regulations) can only be applied to new Power Unit elements, i.e. no element already used 
(Art. 28 of the Sporting Regulations) may be modified. 
5.6

Regulations) can only be applied to new Power Unit elements, i.e. no element already used 
(Art. 28 of the Sporting Regulations) may be modified. 
5.6 
Changes of fuel and oil suppliers will be accepted, provided such changes are intended for 
commercial and not for performance reasons. 
5.7 
With reference to Article 40.3 of the Sporting Regulations, if a Power Unit part is 
subsequently replaced after qualifying practice between the Sprint Qualifying Session and the 
Sprint Session, or between the Qualifying Session and the Race, by another which differs only 
by one or more modifications permitted by this Paragraph 5, the replacement Power Unit 
part will be considered the same in design and similar in mass, inertia and function. 
5.8 
Requests for repair of a PU component in the form of a patch made of the same material or 
made of composite material, following damage or failure, may be accepted if it is only local

5.8 
Requests for repair of a PU component in the form of a patch made of the same material or 
made of composite material, following damage or failure, may be accepted if it is only local 
and minimal. If accepted such repair can be applied to all components available but only on a 
temporary basis. It must not be present on the components used during the following 
Championship season if it is not made of the same material. 
6 
Schedule for the introduction at Events of modified Power Unit parts 
6.1 
The first time one or more Power Units comprising modified parts, as permitted by 
Paragraphs 4 and 5, are used in any of the cars powered by the Power Unit Manufacturer, a 
minimum of 1 Power Unit with the exact same specification must be available for each

Competitor. Each Competitor will have priority use of one of these Power Units until the end

In the case of a Manufacturer supplying Power Units to more than 2 Competitors, one 
exception per Championship season can be granted by the FIA, in its absolute discretion, in 
the event of genuine supply issues. The request must be made in writing to the FIA Technical 
Department and must provide all necessary information and evidence of the supply issue. If 
the FIA is satisfied, the minimum required number of Power Units available for all 
Competitors may be reduced to 2 for the Event where the modified part is used for the first 
time. 
6.2 
Any new Power Unit element used for the first time in an Event must always include all 
modifications included in any Power Unit element already used by any of the cars powered 
by the PU Manufacturer. 
6.3

modifications included in any Power Unit element already used by any of the cars powered 
by the PU Manufacturer. 
6.3 
The requirements of 6.1 and 6.2 don’t apply to minor modifications as defined in 5.2. 
6.4 
A Power Unit element will be deemed to have been used once the car’s timing transponder 
has shown that it has left the pit lane. 
7 
Conformity with the power unit homologation dossier 
All Power Units must be delivered such that the seals required under Article 28.5 of the 
Sporting Regulations can be fitted. Both the Power Unit Manufacturer and users of a 
homologated Power Unit must take whatever steps are required at any time by the FIA 
Technical Department, in its absolute discretion, to demonstrate that a Power Unit used at a 
Competition is in conformity with the corresponding Power Unit homologation dossier.
